_source.text: [0024] It is reported by Senthilkumar and Gunasekaran in 64 Journal of Scientific and Industrial Research 845˜853 (November 2005) that pyruvate decarboxylase and alcohol dehydrogenase genes from Z. mobilis were transformed into Lactobacillus casei by means of an expression vector based in part on Lactococcus lactis, which resulted in the production of ethanol in fermentation at a rate better than the parental Z. mobilis.

text: Research 845˜853 (November 2005) that pyruvate decarboxylase and **alcohol** **dehydrogenase** genes from Z
Lactococcus lactis, which resulted in the production of ethanol in fermentation at a rate **better** **than** the parental Z. mobilis.
